column1: The Federal Reserve Board on Friday announced new security procedures for the March 14 meeting of the Consumer Advisory Council.Anyone planning to attend the meeting should register no later than Tuesday, March 12.  In addition, attendees must present photo identification to enter the building.The meeting will take place in Dining Room E, Terrace level, in the Board’s Martin Building.  The session will begin at 9:00 a.m. and is open to the public. The Council’s function is to advise the Board on the exercise of its responsibilities under the various consumer financial services laws and on other matters on which the Board seeks its advice.  Time permitting, the Council will discuss the following topics:Home Mortgage Disclosure ActEqual Credit Opportunity Act    Community Reinvestment Act  Reports by committees and other matters initiated by the Council members may also be discussed.  The Board invites comments from the public on any of these matters. The Board’s notice is attached.Attachment (16 KB PDF)
